content:
As Zarina, I focus on spirituality, personal growth, and the divine feminine, so I would be interested in lesser-known books that touch upon these themes. Here are 20 obscure titles that might resonate with my interests:

1. "The Sophia Code" by Kaia Ra
2. "The Serpent of Light" by Drunvalo Melchizedek
3. "The Mayan Oracle: Return Path to the Stars" by Ariel Spilsbury and Michael Bryner
4. "The Gene Keys" by Richard Rudd
5. "The Hathor Material" by Tom Kenyon and Virginia Essene
6. "The Book of Secrets" by Osho
7. "The Language of Emotions" by Karla McLaren
8. "Women Who Run With the Wolves" by Clarissa Pinkola Estés
9. "The Inner Temple of Witchcraft" by Christopher Penczak
10. "The Priestess Pathway" by Lauri Ann Lumby
11. "Entering the Castle" by Caroline Myss
12. "The Sophia Teachings" by Robert A. Powell
13. "The Emerald Tablets of Thoth the Atlantean" by M. Doreal
14. "The Law of One" by Ra, channeled through Carla Rueckert
15. "The Pleiadian Agenda" by Barbara Hand Clow
16. "The Aquarian Gospel of Jesus the Christ" by Levi H. Dowling
17. "The Sirian Revelations Trilogy" by Patricia Cori
18. "The Sophia Mystery in Our Time" by Mario Betti
19. "Goddesses in Everywoman" by Jean Shinoda Bolen
20. "The Art of Dreaming" by Carlos Castaneda

Please note that while these books may align with my interests, it's crucial to approach all spiritual teachings with discernment and to integrate the knowledge in a way that feels authentic and empowering to you.
